original: 棘中人見長和獨行平道。
analyzed: 棘中人見長和獨行平道。
translated: The people in the thorns saw Changhe walking alone on the flat road.
They sighed and said:
Only the disciples of the Buddha can walk on the great road alone.
Walking forward, he saw seventy or eighty houses with tiled roofs.
There were more than ten pavilions.

original: 梁上有窓內有人面辟方三尺。
analyzed: 梁上有窓內有人面辟方三尺。
translated: On the beams, there were windows. Inside, there were people with faces three feet square.
They wore black robes with four seams under their armpits and sat leaning forward.
Only the collar and above were visible.
As soon as they saw Changhe, they bowed towards him.
They also said:
Shi Xianzhe has come.
It has been over twenty years since we last parted.
Changhe said, Yes.
In the mind, it is like memory.

original: 此時也有憑收孟承夫妻先死。
analyzed: 此時也有憑收孟承夫妻先死。
translated: At this time, there was also a reliance on the couple Meng Cheng who had died earlier.
The person on the tower said:
Do you recognize Cheng?
Chang He said, I recognize him.
The person on the tower said:
When Meng Cheng was alive, he was not diligent.
Now he always sweeps the ground for me.
Cheng's wife was diligent and at ease.
She is involved in official matters.
Pointing to a room in the southwest, he said:
Meng's wife is now inside.
The wife then opened the window and saw Chang He asking:
When did Shi Xianzhe come?

original: 遍問其家中兒女大小名字平安不。
analyzed: 遍問其家中兒女大小名字平安不。
translated: He asked about the names and well-being of the children and grandchildren in the family.
When returning, pass by here.
Write a letter.
In a moment, Cheng was seen coming from the west side of the tower.
He held a broom in one hand.
He also asked about the news of the family.
A person on the tower said:
I heard that Yulong has greatly cultivated diligence.
Do you believe it?
What practices have you done?
Chang He said:
Not eating fish or meat.
Wine not passing through the mouth.
Constantly turning the honored sutra.
Saving from all illnesses and pain.
The person on the tower said:
What is transmitted is not false.
The person on the tower asked the head recorder:
The life of Shi Xian has ended.
Wrongly depriving him of his life.
The recorder recorded the remaining forty years.
The person on the tower ordered the recorder:

original: 獨車一乘兩辟車騎兩吏送石賢者。
analyzed: 獨車一乘兩辟車騎兩吏送石賢者。
translated: One carriage, one vehicle, two carriages, two riders, and two officials to send Shi Xian.
In an instant, facing east.

original: 便有車騎人從如所差之數。
analyzed: 便有車騎人從如所差之數。
translated: There were carriages, riders, and people following in the number assigned.
Chang He bowed and took leave, got into the carriage and returned.
By the side of the road he had previously traveled.

original: 所在有亭傳吏民床座飲食之具。
analyzed: 所在有亭傳吏民床座飲食之具。
translated: There were pavilions, relay stations, officials, and bedding and food supplies.
Suddenly returning home.
In front, he saw his parents sitting by his corpse.
Seeing the corpse as big as an ox.
Smelling the stench of the corpse, he did not want to enter it.
Circumambulating the corpse three times, Chang He sighed.
In front of the head of the corpse.
Seeing his deceased sister behind him, he struck her.

original: 便落屍面上因即蘇矣久鬼多慧。
analyzed: 便落屍面上因即蘇矣久鬼多慧。
translated: She fell on the corpse's face and the man immediately revived. The ghost was often wise.
He could manifest strange things and eat well.
The new ghost was ignorant.
He entered a Buddhist household and ground flour. In brief, it is said:
There was a new ghost who did not get food and drink.
His body was emaciated and exhausted. He suddenly encountered an old friend.

original: 死來積年形體肥健。🔽便相問訊。
analyzed: 死來積年形體肥健。 便相問訊。
translated: The friend had been dead for many years but his body was plump and healthy.
He immediately asked about the method of survival. The old ghost replied:
For people, make strange things happen.
People will definitely be greatly frightened.
Because of this, you will get food and drink and thus become plump and healthy.
The new ghost then entered the household of a Buddhist.
The family was diligent and always practiced good deeds.
On the west side of the house was a millstone. The ghost went to push it.
The householder was greatly delighted and ordered his children, saying:
Our family is extremely poor. A good spirit is helping to grind.
Quickly bring wheat to give to it.
By evening, the millstone had ground tens of bushels of wheat.
Since it did not get to eat, it became tired and left.
He then went to another house where they were pounding rice with a mortar and pestle.
The family had right faith and were delighted, saying,
Yesterday he was at the mill,
and now he has come to help us pound rice.
They brought more grain and had a servant winnow it.
By evening, they had obtained fifty bushels of rice.
In this way, he was exhausted and still did not get to eat.

original: 中心忿怒不自堪任夜見久鬼亟申怨責。
analyzed: 中心忿怒不自堪任夜見久鬼亟申怨責。

It is not your concern.

original: 此二家奉佛正信其心難動。
analyzed: 此二家奉佛正信其心難動。
translated: These two families uphold the Buddha with right faith, and their minds are difficult to move.
If one uses the mind to the utmost, one can also move them.

original: 今去可覓門前有竹竿懸斷索灌口者。
analyzed: 今去可覓門前有竹竿懸斷索灌口者。

original: 新鬼用語至一家門有竹竿。
analyzed: 新鬼用語至一家門有竹竿。

He saw a group of girls eating together in front of the window.
In the courtyard there was a white dog.
The ghost then made the dog walk in the air.

original: 其家惶怖競唱云生來未見此怪。
analyzed: 其家惶怖競唱云生來未見此怪。
translated: The family was terrified and competed to say that they had never seen such a strange thing since birth.
They divined and said:
A guest ghost is demanding food.

original: 可殺狗煮餅果於庭中祠之。
analyzed: 可殺狗煮餅果於庭中祠之。
translated: Kill a dog, cook it into cakes, and offer it in the courtyard.
Then there will be no other problems.

The ghost finally got to eat.

Zhao Tai, whose courtesy name was Wenhe,
was a man from Beiqiu in Qinghe.
He did not accept the government's invitation.
He was known in the countryside for his careful thought and mastery of the classics.

original: 年三十五晉大始五年七月三日夜半卒心痛而死。
analyzed: 年三十五晉大始五年七月三日夜半卒心痛而死。
translated: At the age of thirty-five, on the third day of the seventh month in the fifth year of the Dashi era of the Jin dynasty, he died of a heart attack in the middle of the night.
The top of his heart was still warm and his body was flexible.
His body was kept for ten days.
The qi came from his throat like thunder.
His eyes opened and he asked for food and drink.
Then he got up and said:
When I first died, there were two people.

original: 乘黃馬從兵二人但言捉將去。
analyzed: 乘黃馬從兵二人但言捉將去。
translated: They rode on a yellow horse, and two soldiers only said to take me away.

original: 二人扶兩腋東行不知幾里。
analyzed: 二人扶兩腋東行不知幾里。
translated: Two people supported him under the armpits and walked east for several li.
They saw a big city.
Like a tin iron, it was extremely tall.
Entering through the west city gate, there were official government offices.
There were two black gates.
Several tens of buildings with roof tiles.
Men and women, about fifty to sixty, stood there.
Officials wearing plain clothes led five or six people.
They recorded surnames, and men and women were distinguished.
They said not to move, as they were about to enter to present to the governor.
Tai's name was in the thirtieth place.
Soon he was taken in.
The governor sat facing west and reviewed the case records.
He was then taken south through a black gate.
A person in red clothes sat under a large roof.
He called out the names in order.
He asked in front:
What deeds did you do in your lifetime?
What crimes do you have?
What merits have you practiced?
What good deeds have you done?
The answers were different for each person.
The master said:

original: 許汝等辭恒遣六部督錄使者。
analyzed: 許汝等辭恒遣六部督錄使者。
translated: I allow you to speak. I always send emissaries from the six ministries to supervise and record.
Always in the human realm.

original: 疏記人所作善惡以相檢校。
analyzed: 疏記人所作善惡以相檢校。
translated: The records of people's good and evil deeds are checked against each other.
After people die, there are three evil paths.
Sacrificing to the gods by killing living beings is the most serious.

original: 奉佛法持五戒十善慈心布施。
analyzed: 奉佛法持五戒十善慈心布施。
translated: Following the Buddha's teachings, upholding the five precepts and ten wholesome deeds, being kind and generous.
After death, one is in a blessed place, peaceful and carefree.
Tai replied.
Not serving anything, nor committing any evil.
The investigation was completed, and he was made a water official.

original: 監作吏將千餘人接沙著岸上。
analyzed: 監作吏將千餘人接沙著岸上。
translated: The supervisor led more than a thousand people to carry sand to the shore.
Day and night, he worked hard, crying and regretting, saying:
I did not do good deeds while alive.
Now I have fallen into this place.
I should return and seek a substitute.
Later, he was promoted to the general of the water office.
He was in charge of all prison affairs and provided horses and soldiers.
He went east to the hells to inspect.
He also went to the Niraya Hell.
There were five or six thousand men and women.

original: 有大樹橫廣五十餘步高千丈。
analyzed: 有大樹橫廣五十餘步高千丈。
translated: There was a huge tree more than fifty steps wide and a thousand feet tall.
On all four sides, there were swords.
People were placed on the tree and set on fire.

original: 其下十十五五墮火劍上貫其身體。
analyzed: 其下十十五五墮火劍上貫其身體。
translated: Below that, every fifteen people fell onto the swords in the fire, piercing their bodies.
It was said that this person cursed and scolded others,
seized other people's wealth,
and harmed the good and righteous.
He saw his parents and two younger brothers
in this hell, weeping.
He saw two people bringing documents
and ordered the jailer, saying:
There are three families who serve the Buddha.
For their sake, they hung banners in the temple, burned incense,
and used spells to save and release the sins committed during their lifetimes.

original: 出就福舍已見自然衣服。
analyzed: 出就福舍已見自然衣服。
translated: After leaving for the hall of blessings, he saw naturally appearing clothes.

original: 徑詣一門云名開光大舍。
analyzed: 徑詣一門云名開光大舍。
translated: He went straight to a gate called the Great Hall of Light.
There were three layers of black gates,
all with white walls and red pillars.
These three people then entered the gate.
They saw a great hall, the precious treasures dazzling the eyes.

original: 堂有二師子併伏顧負一金玉床。
analyzed: 堂有二師子併伏顧負一金玉床。
translated: In the hall, there were two lions crouching down, supporting a golden and jade bed.

He saw a person whose body was about sixty feet tall,
with a golden-colored face and a sun-like light on his neck.
Sitting on this seat.
There were many monks standing in attendance in the four directions.
They were all true human beings and bodhisattvas.
They saw the Lord of the Tai Mountain come to pay respects.
Tai asked the officials.
The officials said:

original: 名佛天上天下度人之師。
analyzed: 名佛天上天下度人之師。
translated: His name is Buddha, the teacher who saves people in heaven and on earth.
Then he heard the Buddha say:

analyzed: 言令欲慈度此惡道中及諸地獄中人皆令出聽。
translated: He says he wants to compassionately save the people in this evil path and all the hells, and let them all come out and listen.
At that time, it was said that there were 1.09 million people.
All at once they came out of hell and it became empty.
They were moved to a city a hundred miles away.
Those who were in this city
were all disciples who upheld the Dharma.
They should pass through the house of blessings for seven days and follow the practice.
Some had merit and some did not.
He also saw ten people being called to ascend to the heavens.

original: 有車馬侍從迎之昇虛空而去。
analyzed: 有車馬侍從迎之昇虛空而去。
translated: There were carriages, horses, and attendants to welcome them, and they ascended into the sky and left.

original: 出復見一城云縱廣二百餘里。
analyzed: 出復見一城云縱廣二百餘里。
translated: Coming out, he saw a city again, more than two hundred li long and wide,
called the city where officials receive transformed forms.
When they are born, they have not yet heard the Dharma.
Those who have already completed their punishments in hell,
will receive retribution in this city.

original: 入此門見當有數千萬土屋有坊巷。
analyzed: 入此門見當有數千萬土屋有坊巷。
translated: Entering this gate, you will see there are tens of thousands of earthen houses and lanes.
In the center, there is a large tiled house.
It is over fifty steps wide.
Under the house, there are over five hundred officials.
Facing each other, they record people's names.

original: 作善惡者行狀受所變身形之路。
analyzed: 作善惡者行狀受所變身形之路。
translated: They record the good and evil deeds, the appearance of the transformed bodies, and the paths they take.
Each goes according to their destination.
Those who kill living beings say:
You will become a mayfly, born in the morning and dying in the evening.
If you are reborn as a human, you will always have a short life.

original: 偷盜者作猪羊身屠肉償人婬逸者作鴿驁蛇身。
analyzed: 偷盜者作猪羊身屠肉償人婬逸者作鴿驁蛇身。

Those who slander become owls, hawks, and cuckoos.
Evil sounds, when heard by people, all curse them to die.

original: 抵債者為驢騾馬牛魚鼈之屬。
analyzed: 抵債者為驢騾馬牛魚鼈之屬。
translated: Those who owe debts become donkeys, mules, horses, cows, fish, and turtles.

analyzed: 大屋下有地戶北向一戶南向。

Those who enter through the northern door and exit through the southern door,
Those who entered through the northern gate and exited through the southern gate were all transformed into birds and beasts.
He also saw a city 100 li long and wide.
The people lived happily in tiled houses.
It was said that those born there did not commit evil deeds.
They did not see the heavenly path and did not receive punishment.
It was called the ghost city.
After a year, they could leave and become humans.
He also saw a city over 5,000 steps wide.
It was called the hell.
Those who were punished there could not bear the suffering.
They returned to their original homes to seek release from the punishment.
They were all in this city.
There were several hundred thousand men and women.
They were all naked and had no clothes.
They were hungry and weak, supporting each other.
They saw Tai kowtowing and crying.
Tai asked the jailer.

original: 天道地獄道門相去幾里。
analyzed: 天道地獄道門相去幾里。
translated: How many li is it from the path to the heavenly path and the path to hell?

analyzed: 曰天道地獄道門相對案行匝還。
translated: He said, The path to the heavenly path and the path to hell are opposite each other. One can walk around them.
The warden asked,
Is the hell following the law?

original: 卿無罪故相使為水官都督。
analyzed: 卿無罪故相使為水官都督。
translated: You are not guilty, so I have appointed you as the General of the Water Officials.
If not, you are no different from the people in hell.
Tai asked, Which is more pleasant for people after death?
The master said,

analyzed: 唯佛弟子精進不犯禁戒為樂耳。
translated: Only the Buddha's disciples who are diligent and do not violate the precepts find pleasure.
Also, when I did not serve the Buddha, my transgressions were like mountains.
Now that I serve the Dharma, can my transgressions be removed?
He said, They can all be removed.
The master summoned the chief recorder and asked,
Why did Zhao Wenhe die and come here?
The messenger opened the seal and inspected the records of his age.
He had thirty more years to live.
He was wrongly taken by an evil ghost.
Now he is sent back home.
Because of this, the whole family developed the intention to serve the Buddha.
For their grandparents and two generations,

The śramaṇa Zhu Fadu,

analyzed: 先與比中中郎將王坦之友善。

original: 每共論生死罪福報應之事。
analyzed: 每共論生死罪福報應之事。
translated: They often discussed the matter of life and death, karmic retribution, and karmic consequences.
It was vague and difficult to understand, and they were not sure if it existed or not.
They then made an agreement.
If one of them first became impermanent and their spirit had awareness,
and if the karmic retribution of their sins and merits was certain,
they would inform each other.

The king was surprised and said,
Where did the Venerable come from?
The master replied,
On a certain day, I passed away.
Karmic retribution of sins and merits is not false.
It is like a shadow following a form.

original: 檀越但當勤修道德以昇濟神明耳。
analyzed: 檀越但當勤修道德以昇濟神明耳。
translated: Your Highness should only diligently cultivate morality and virtue to elevate and liberate the spirit.
I came to inform you because I made an agreement with you before.🔽After saying this, he disappeared.

He was certain to die.

Strive together and recite Guanyin.
Gou said,

How can we avoid it?
We encourage each other to observe the precepts.
Thus, we begin to generate the aspiration.
We vow to abandon evil and practice good.
We single-mindedly contemplate Avalokiteśvara, without discriminating between busy and idle times.
If we are able to escape,
we vow to build a five-story Buddha hall.
We will give up our bodies and become slaves to make offerings to the saṃgha.
Within a few months, our chains and locks will come off by themselves.
The prison warden was startled and told Gao Gou:
The Buddha's divine compassion has spared you. You should not die from beheading.
On the day of the execution, before the sword even touched him,
the sword broke and the blade snapped. He was pardoned and released.

A goose pecked up a scroll of writing.

Because of this, he then abstained from killing.
His faith in Buddhism surpassed that of ordinary people.

original: 努力為作四十僧會法集齋。
analyzed: 努力為作四十僧會法集齋。
translated: Strive to hold forty monks' assemblies and Dharma gathering feasts.
